pullRequest.body:
See [the Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Subset.20equal.20.7B0.7D.20of.20Subsingleton/near/402193512)

Co-authored-by: Ruben Van de Velde <ruben.vandevelde+github@gmail.com>

Co-authored-by: Junyan Xu <junyanxumath@gmail.com>


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6903131519/job/18781218561)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6903131519/job/18781219145)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6903131519/job/18781219401)
Naming wise, I'd expect `h.eq_singleton` or `h.eq_singleton_of_unique`.
idem for these two

Yes, I'll change the names. I think I'll go for `eq_singleton_[zero/one]_of_unique` for the ones using [Unique] and just `eq_singleton_[zero/one]` for the ones using `Subsingleton` since they are probably the most useful.
this seems like a footgun, for just `Subsingleton` I'd go with `s = {h.choose}`
I am not sure about that part indeed. This is the code from @Ruben-VandeVelde. I don't feel confortable enough with this part of the library to know if it's the right way to do it.
i worry about these lemmas being `@[simp]` but I think that this is not what most people think, I just think they'll be slow
No, you are right. These should not be [simp]. I forgot to change it back.
these should be dot notation too

I suggest that you only add two lemmas as others are direct applications:
```suggestion
theorem eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton {α} [Subsingleton α] (s t : Set α)
    [Nonempty s] [Nonempty t] : s = t :=
  nonempty_of_nonempty_subtype.eq_univ.trans nonempty_of_nonempty_subtype.eq_univ.symm

theorem eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {α} [Subsingleton α] {s : Set α} (t : Set α)
    (hs : s.Nonempty) [Nonempty t] : s = t :=
  have := hs.to_subtype; eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton s t

theorem Nonempty.eq_singleton_of_unique [Unique α] {s : Set α} (h : s.Nonempty) :
    s = {default} := eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {default} h

theorem Nonempty.eq_singleton_zero_of_unique [Zero α] [Unique α] {s : Set α} (h : s.Nonempty) :
    s = {0} := eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {0} h

theorem Nonempty.eq_singleton_one_of_unique [One α] [Unique α] {s : Set α} (h : s.Nonempty) :
    s = {1} := eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {1} h

theorem Nonempty.eq_of_subsingleton [Subsingleton α] {s : Set α} (h : s.Nonempty) (a : α) :
    s = {a} := eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {a} h

theorem Nonempty.eq_zero [Subsingleton α] [Zero α] {s : Set α} (h : s.Nonempty) :
    s = {0} := eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {0} h

theorem Nonempty.subset_eq_one [Subsingleton α] [One α] {s : Set α} (h : s.Nonempty) :
    s = {1} := eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {1} h
```
Typeclass inference is able to fine `Nonempty {a}` for any `a`.
LGTM (modulo some small name changes). Thanks!
I'm suggesting you only keep the first two lemmas. What do you think? Certainly if you have a [Subsingleton α] lemma you don't need the [Unique α] lemma with otherwise the same assumptions.

I'd like to keep the lemmas `Nonempty.eq_zero` and `Nonempty.eq_zero`. I think it's a very convenient to replace easily any nonempty subset of, say, a trivial ring by {0}. This is actually the reason why I started this PR. I don't care that much about the [Unique] versions.
BTW, since you are now listed as co-author, feel free to push any change you want to make ;)
Do you use `eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton'` as a rewrite lemma? If so, does it not work if you `rw [h.eq_of_nonempty_of_subsingleton' {0}]` instead of `rw [h.eq_zero]`?
Probably, but I think it is more natural to use `h.eq_zero`. Especially, since it is a situation that should come up quite often...
Let's up open this PR for review and see what reviewers think...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Add Set.Nonempty.eq_zero and variations
